ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Disaster Management, Health & Family Welfare, HIV/AIDS, Micro Finance (SHGs), Micro Small & Medium Enterprises, Panchayati Raj, Right to Information & Advocacy, Rural Development & Poverty Alleviation, Urban Development & Poverty Alleviation, Vocational Training, Womenâ€™s Development & Empowerment, West Bengal, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Meghalaya Murshidabad, Malda, Nadia, North Dinajpur, South Dinajpur, Bankura, Birbhum, Purulia, East Medinipur, West Medinipur, Jalpaiguri, Provided Capacity Building support to at least 2,00,000 NGO workers, SHG Members and Leaders, Cluster Leaders, Sub Cluster Leaders, SHPI Functionaries, etc. on SHG Management, Cluster & Sub Cluster Formation & Management, etc. with the sponsorship of Panchayat & Rural Development Department, Govt. of West Bengal, NABARD, Local NGOs. Published many Books, Training Tools, Flip Charts, etc. and already distributed about 1,70,000 copies of a Handbook on Basics of SHG Management and a Self Evaluation Chart for SHGs. Has developed a vibrant Trainers Team comprising about 20 trainers which caters to the Capacity Building needs of the SHGs and allied institutions on SHG Management, Cluster & Sub Cluster Promotion and Management, Livelihood Interventions including Marketing Fundamentals, Accounts & Financial Management which is well recognized by Panchayat & Rural Development Department and Women Development Department of Government of West Bengal, NABARD â€“ Kolkata Regional Office, Tripura, Meghalaya, Arunachal Pradesh, and numerous local NGOs. Experienced in Community Based Disaster Preparedness and Early Warning Advocacy and was a partner of UNICEF, OXFAM, CARITAS, and Disaster Management Department of Govt. of West Bengal. Proficient in conducting Study, Research and Documentation that had been utilized by Irrigation & Water Ways Department Govt. of West Bengal, OXFAM, Action Aid, etc. Placed a team of Trainers under Silliguri Mahakuma Parishad and DRDC Malda for 2 years for developing for strengthening SHGs and addressing Livelihood Promotion Programs. Presently, a team of trainers are capacitating the members of Thrift and Credit Groups under Siliguri Municipal Corporation sponsored by State Urban Development Authority. Already promoted and is strengthening two SHG member owned and managed Federations for addressing Micro Finance, Livelihood Promotion and Community Based Disaster Management programs in the flood prone areas of Nabadwip and Kandi Blocks of Nadia and Murshidabad districts of West Bengal. Promoted preventive and promotive healthcare and HIV AIDS Awareness through the sponsorship of UNICEF and NACO Promoted a Business Counseling and Facilitating Center for the SHG members of Murshidabad district under the Rural Innovative Fund of NABARD. Conducting SHG Bank Linkage Training Program, Training of Trainers on Micro Enterprise Development Program, Financial Literacy Promotion Training Program of NABARD. Also conducted ToT on PRA PLA for the Lead NGO Staff and officials of NABARD Kolkata Regional Office. Provided Capacity Building support to the People Living with HIV AIDS and other members of High Risk Group on SHG Formation and Management sponsored by WBSAC&PS and World Vision, Kolkata. Provided Capacity Building support to the Artisans on Group Dynamics and Sustainable Enterprise Development sponsored by Development Commissioner, Handicrafts, Ministry of Textile, Govt. of India. Was an Institution Monitor of CAPART for two years. As a partner of WBCSSP, has established partnership with 16 SHPIs in Murshidabad and is promoting awareness on Right to Information, Effective Implementation of NREGA, etc.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: We Sri binayak foundation look forward to bring a better future in the hands of needy , challenged people to bring a better tomorrow. So slowly and steadily we have planned to reach maximum areas where there is a need for help to change the living of needy and poor people, physically challenged people.Already now some of the institutes are approaching us,we are hoping to get the correct hands of support.

Not many people have yet seen our work once we start spreading , which we are already doing and day by day reaching many people we will surely get the approach of the right personal who will be ready to give their hands , and day by day we will raise our helping hands to many more needier and give our contribution to make a better developed society. We kept on moving, kept on going with our motive, our vision. So in this manner we are moving on and in this journey all our work have been solely.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Out Reach Eye Screening Programs are organized in rural and urban areas of Midnapore Districts, West Bengal. It also covers adjacent areas of this district through different satellite centers and in the different schools. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SWADHIN, a registered trust, registered office at Gushkara, Aushgram Road, Burdwan has started during the year 2009. The Mission includes, empowering the target group with knowledge and skill across various sectors, thus enabling to earn social and economic status. The Objectives includes, establishing Educational, Technical, and Vocational Institutions and operating such institutions with desired outcome for the benefit of the target group without any profit. Our Endeavours are as follows- 1. SANTINIKETAN INSTITUTE OF POLYTECHNIC offering Diploma courses in 6 Branches with seating capacity of 2052 students 2. SANTINIKETAN INSTITUTE OF POLYTECHNIC is empanelled training provider under SDIS and has trained 1051 students till now in 10 different sectors out of which 1041 students have already been placed. 3. SANTINIKETAN D.Ed. COLLEGE providing D.Ed courses with 100 intake capacity. 4. SANTINIKETAN D.Ed College is empanelled training provider under SDIS and has trained 313 students till now in 4 different sectors out of which 311 students have already been placed. 5. SANTINIKETAN B.Ed. COLLEGE providing B.Ed courses with 200 intake capacity. 6. SANTINIKETAN PRIVATE ITI offering 5 Trades with intake capacity of 230 students. 7. 10 VTC offering Short Term courses with NCVT Certification in around 30 Modules with seating capacity of 1200 students 8.Further SWADHIN has been offered as a Private Training Provider through RFP and awarded by Government of West Bengal to operate 10 ITIs in PPP mode. According to PPP architecture, SWADHIN is responsible for bringing in all the training equipments,experienced faculties, learning resources and operation of these ITIs including day to day management and also be responsible for achieving predefined KPIs against charges paid by Government of West Bengal as per the tripartite Concession Agreement between GoWB, SWADHIN and NSDC. The role of GoWB includes creating the basic infrastructure viz. land, building, electricity, approach road, water supply etc. These ITIs will be offering CTS courses leading to NTC from NCVT in 15 different Trades with seating capacity of 3717 students. 9.SWADHIN has spread its operation in far flaung and difficult areas of the country. SWADHIN opened 2 Private ITIs. Those are SWADHIN TRIPURA PRIVATE ITI offering Fitter and Electrician Trades at Tripura and SWADHIN PORT BLAIR ITI offering IT and Electrician Trades at Port Blair. 10.SWADHIN also receive PRN from MoRD and has submitted proposal for implementing DDUGKY, under MoRD, Government of India targeting to uplift the skillsets of rural youth and to provide them with attractive job offers. Thus today SWADHIN has developed sturdy organizational competencies in the field of Technical and Vocational Education and Skill Training with a highly motivated and dedicated team and ready to undertake any venture in the domain to realize the mission.
